description: This walk explores the Wigan Flashes National Nature Reserve in the town of Wigan, Greater Manchester. The reserve includes a series of large lakes and some easy trails along the Leeds and Liverpool Canal. Habitats at the site include reedbed, fen, rough grassland, wet woodland and scrub. It's great for wildlife with great crested grebe, bittern, heron, reed buntings, willow tits, reed warblers, sedge warblers, common terns and water rails to look out for. Flora includes lilac, marsh helleborine, orchids and evening primrose. To continue your walking in the area follow the canal south to visit Pennington Flash Country Park .
